titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Classes of 1921-1930 records CA.MS.01019

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-01-04 11:51:05 -0500.

change.item: Finding aids for each class records were combined into this meta record, with additions from recent accessions

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: A portion of these materials were transferred to College Archives in 14 accessions between 1998 and 2017. Whenever donation information for a particular set of material is known, it is included in the finding aid below. However, a majority of the material was not formally accessioned and its origins are not currently known.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection brings together ten record groups that are arranged chronologically, one per graduating class. However, since some materials are placed in a class record group based on when they were created, and not by whom, materials relelvant to a class may exist in more than one series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Classes of 1921-1930 records, Box #, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-01019, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The Classes of 1921-1930 records consist of individual class notes, examinations, papers and class letters, correspondence, photographs, scrapbooks, songbooks as well as reunion materials of the same nature, all related to or dating from the time periods during which these classes were students at Smith College.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be governed by copyright. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. Researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Class of 1921 was the forty-third graduating class of Smith College.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Class of 1921 records were processed by Tiffany Tawzer in 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Class of 1921 records contain materials describing the history and activities of the Class of 1921, including materials from commencement, reunions, senior dramatics, and other important events. Types of materials include photographs, invitations, songs, newspaper clippings, Treasurer's records, pamphlets, and other memorabilia. Individual biographical files often include photographs, photo albums, newspaper clippings, letters and correspondences, and class notes.

They also contain a photograph album whose creator, Lilian Sullivan, is of unknown relationship to Smith College, but which contains a large number of photographs of the Smith College campus from around 1919-1921.

did.unittitle: Lillian Sullivan photograph album of Smith College

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph album of Lillian Sullivan, unknown connection to Smith College, but with extensive images of the College around 1919-1921.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Sharlene Van Rooy, unknown connection to Lillian Sullivan

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: As a preservation measure, researchers must use digital copies of audiovisual materials in this collection. Please consult with Special Collections staff to request the creation of and access to digital copies.

Types of materials include photographs, invitations, songs, newspaper clippings, letters, questionnaires, and other memorabilia.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: As a preservation measure, researchers must use digital copies of audiovisual materials in this collection. Please consult with Special Collections staff to request the creation of and access to digital copies.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Moynihan has retained copyright in her works donated to Smith College. Copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For those few instances beyond fair use, or which may regard materials in the collection not created by Moynihan, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
